page.title: 07THE CHURCH REMAINS AND TREES
page.content: There are some {church remains }in Silverley a village which has been knocked down near Cheveley. Henry the Eighth told Thomas Cromwell to knock down the church. The tower remained. {August 1971}the council told builders to knock it down. Jim Claydon a governor of our school got local people to sign a petition to stop the builders.It was saved. The tower has arches at the back and front and you can see part of the spiral staircase. Birds nest there. There are trees around the remains: {Beech, Sycamore, Common Alder}and{Yew. We measured the height of the biggest tree, a{Beech.}We used half metre and metre sticks, put the metre stick down, stood the half metre by it and lined it up with the tree .The distance along the ground was {43m}so the height of the tree is{21.5}metres.
